page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: In 1981 the population of Didcot was 15,418. It is estimated that in five years from 1985 the population will be 20,000. There are 1414 Council houses in 1985. 304 will be built within 5 years. There are 3100 private houses in 1985. 1200 more are expected to be built within five years. There are several new estates in Didcot, including Barleyfields, Millbrook and Hagbourne Downs. At Barleyfields there are 3\4 bedroom detached houses and two-car garages. All the 35 detached houses at Hagbourne Downs have two gardens. In August 1984 the buildings were begun at Millbrook. Most of the 118 buildings, which include some flats, had been sold by June 1985. These are all semi-detached and have two gardens. Some of the houses have one bedroom.
